description:
## Objective
Based on investigation results (citations-l5x), decide how to update fonts in PSEO static pages.

## Prerequisites
- citations-l5x complete (investigation done)
- citations-6x8 complete (CSS updated with new fonts)

## Possible Strategies (choose based on investigation)

### Option A: Full Regeneration
If pages use inline CSS consistently:
- Regenerate all PSEO pages with updated CSS
- Test sample pages before mass regeneration
- Deploy all at once

### Option B: External CSS Migration
If mixed approach or many manual pages:
- Modify generator to use external CSS links
- Update single CSS file in production
- Regenerate pages gradually

### Option C: Staged Rollout
If hundreds of pages need regeneration:
- Prioritize high-traffic pages
- Regenerate in batches
- Monitor analytics between batches

### Option D: CSS Injection
If pages already link external CSS:
- Update CSS file directly on production
- No regeneration needed

## Deliverables
- Decision documented in issue comments
- Rationale based on investigation findings
- Risk assessment
- Estimated effort/timeline
- Create follow-up implementation issue(s)

## Success Criteria
Clear implementation plan for PSEO font migration with defined approach and next steps.

title: Update CSS typography system with new fonts
description:
## Objective
Replace system fonts with Crimson Pro (body), Work Sans (headings/UI), and JetBrains Mono (citations/code) using CSS custom properties.

## Target Font Scheme
- **Crimson Pro**: Body text, paragraphs, explanatory content
- **Work Sans**: All headings (h1-h6), buttons, navigation, UI elements
- **JetBrains Mono**: Citations, code blocks, monospace content

## Files to Update
1. `frontend/frontend/src/index.css` - React app base styles
2. `frontend/frontend/src/App.css` - React component styles
3. `backend/pseo/builder/assets/css/styles.css` - PSEO template styles

## Implementation
Define CSS custom properties in :root:
```css
:root {
  --font-body: 'Crimson Pro', Georgia, serif;
  --font-heading: 'Work Sans', -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, sans-serif;
  --font-mono: 'JetBrains Mono', 'Courier New', Consolas, monospace;
  font-family: var(--font-body);
}

h1, h2, h3, h4, h5, h6 { font-family: var(--font-heading); }
button, .nav-links, .logo-text { font-family: var(--font-heading); }
.citation-editor, .citation-html, code, pre { font-family: var(--font-mono); }
```

## Testing
- Visual review of all major sections
- Check font fallbacks work without Google Fonts
- Verify monospace applies to citations only
- Test responsive layouts

## Success Criteria
- CSS variables defined in both React and PSEO styles
- All text uses correct font family
- Fallback fonts work properly
- No layout breaks

title: Test and deploy React app with new fonts
description:
## Objective
Validate new fonts in React app locally, build for production, and deploy.

## Prerequisites
- citations-6x8 must be complete (CSS updated)

## Steps
1. **Local testing**:
   - Run `npm run dev`
   - Test homepage hero section
   - Test citation input/output areas
   - Test all headings and body text
   - Check mobile responsive views
   - Verify font loading performance

2. **Build**:
   - Run `npm run build`
   - Test build with `npm run preview`
   - Verify fonts in production build

3. **Deploy**:
   - Commit: `git commit -m "feat: update fonts to Crimson Pro, Work Sans, JetBrains Mono"`
   - Push: `git push origin main`
   - SSH to VPS: `ssh deploy@178.156.161.140`
   - Deploy: `cd /opt/citations && ./deployment/scripts/deploy.sh`

4. **Production validation**:
   - Verify homepage loads with new fonts
   - Test citation checker functionality
   - Check browser console for errors
   - Validate font loading times

## Testing Checklist
- [ ] Homepage renders correctly
- [ ] All headings use Work Sans
- [ ] Body text uses Crimson Pro
- [ ] Citations use JetBrains Mono
- [ ] Mobile layout works
- [ ] No FOUT (flash of unstyled text)
- [ ] Font files load successfully

## Rollback Plan
If issues found:
- Revert commit: `git revert HEAD`
- Rebuild and redeploy

## Success Criteria
- React app deployed with new fonts
- All font families render correctly
- No visual or functional regressions
- Performance acceptable

title: Investigate PSEO CSS architecture and deployment consistency
description:
## Objective
Understand how PSEO pages are structured in production vs dev to determine the correct font migration strategy.

## Why This Matters
Initial investigation found PSEO pages embed CSS inline in <style> tags. Before regenerating hundreds of pages, we need to:
1. Confirm this is consistent across ALL production pages
2. Understand which pages exist where (prod-only, dev-only, synced)
3. Identify any edge cases or manual modifications
4. Choose optimal regeneration strategy (full, partial, external CSS, etc.)

## Specific Questions to Answer
1. **Production inventory**: How many HTML pages exist on production? What directories/routes?
2. **CSS methodology**: Do ALL pages use inline CSS, or are there external stylesheet links too?
3. **Dev/prod parity**: Does folder structure match? Are there orphaned pages in prod?
4. **Font declarations**: Current font-family values (verify consistency)
5. **Page generation**: Which pages were generated vs manually copied?
6. **External assets**: Where are CSS/JS assets stored? (/assets/css/*, /app-assets/*, etc.)

## Deliverables
- Inventory of production HTML pages (count, paths, types)
- CSS loading methodology report (inline vs external breakdown)
- Dev/prod file structure comparison
- List of any anomalies or edge cases
- Recommendation on regeneration approach

## Success Criteria
Clear decision on how to proceed with PSEO font migration based on evidence.
